items.name: Mausoleum of Sidi Ahmed El-Kounti
items.short_description: A revered tomb of a foundational Sufi scholar, believed to be a source of baraka (blessings) and spiritual guidance for the local community.
items.address: Rue 209, Tevragh-Zeina, Nouakchott

items.name: Shrine of Lalla Fatma
items.short_description: Dedicated to a legendary female saint, this humble shrine is a place for women to seek solace, make supplications, and share their hopes and fears.
items.address: Quartier BTP, Dar Naim, Nouakchott

items.name: Tomb of the Unknown Sage
items.short_description: An ancient, unmarked tomb believed to hold the remains of a great scholar or ascetic from the city's earliest days, attracting those seeking forgotten wisdom.
items.address: El Mina District, near old fishing port, Nouakchott

items.name: Zawiya of Sheikh Hamdoun
items.short_description: A small Zawiya (Sufi lodge) housing the tomb of Sheikh Hamdoun, known for his poetic piety and commitment to communal harmony. A center for spiritual gatherings.
items.address: Avenue Gamal Abdel Nasser, Ksar, Nouakchott

items.name: The Path of Baraka (Route to Sidi Ahmed El-Kounti)
items.short_description: A historic walking route from the city center to the Mausoleum of Sidi Ahmed El-Kounti, undertaken by pilgrims seeking blessings and spiritual purification.
items.address: Starts near Grand Marché, Nouakchott, ends at Rue 209, Tevragh-Zeina

items.name: Al-Hajj al-Saghir (The Small Pilgrimage)
items.short_description: A symbolic pilgrimage loop connecting 7 historic mosques and Sufi centers within Nouakchott, performed to gain spiritual merit and communal solidarity.
items.address: Starts and ends at Friday Mosque, Ksar, Nouakchott

items.name: Route of the Seven Stars
items.short_description: An ancient desert path leading just outside the city to seven natural rock formations, believed to align with celestial bodies and offer profound meditation points.
items.address: Starts from PK 10, road to Akjoujt, Nouakchott

items.name: Pilgrimage of Repentance (Wadi al-Maghfira)
items.short_description: A contemplative route along a dry wadi bed, leading to a secluded prayer spot. Used historically for seeking forgiveness and inner peace.
items.address: Behind the University of Nouakchott, heading east

items.name: Dar al-Hikma (House of Wisdom)
items.short_description: A modern Sufi retreat center and hermitage on the city's outskirts, offering space for reflection, Quranic study, and traditional Islamic sciences.
items.address: Outskirts of Toujounine, Nouakchott

items.name: The Hermitage of the Silent Dunes
items.short_description: A series of small, secluded mud-brick cells integrated into the sand dunes, historically used by ascetic scholars for intensive prayer and solitary contemplation.
items.address: South-east of Nouakchott, near dune fields

items.name: Khanqah of the Desert Bloom
items.short_description: A small, self-sufficient spiritual community focused on ecological harmony and traditional Islamic spirituality, often hosting visitors for short stays.
items.address: Approx. 20 km east of Nouakchott city limits

items.name: Zawiya al-Khamsa (The Fivefold Retreat)
items.short_description: A cluster of five small, interconnected rooms within an old mud-brick compound, each dedicated to a specific spiritual practice, used for short, intensive retreats.
items.address: Rue 305, Sebkha, Nouakchott

items.name: The Market of Destinies (Souk al-Aqdar)
items.short_description: The oldest and busiest market square in Nouakchott, believed to be a 'crossroads of destinies' where paths converge, fortunes are made, and life's choices are often influenced.
items.address: Grand Marché Square, Ksar, Nouakchott

items.name: Bab al-Fatih (Gate of Openings)
items.short_description: An ancient, symbolic city gate (no longer existing as a physical structure, marked by a plaza) where travelers would traditionally offer prayers for a safe journey and new beginnings.
items.address: Intersection of Rue de l'Indépendance and Avenue Moktar Ould Daddah, Nouakchott

items.name: The Junction of Whispers (Maltaga al-Hamsat)
items.short_description: A less-known urban crossroads where, according to local folklore, subtle spiritual energies converge, making it a place to listen for guidance and intuition.
items.address: Corner of Rue 12 and Boulevard de la R.I.A., Tevragh-Zeina

items.name: The Crossroads of Sands and Sea
items.short_description: The point where the desert sands meet the Atlantic coast, symbolizing the convergence of two powerful natural elements and a place for profound contemplation of existence.
items.address: Northern beach, Nouakchott, near Port de l'Amitié

items.name: Ain al-Shifa (Spring of Healing)
items.short_description: A historic well renowned for its supposedly miraculous healing waters, sought by those suffering from ailments and seeking spiritual renewal.
items.address: Near old Ksar quarter, Nouakchott

items.name: Bi'r al-Hikma (Well of Wisdom)
items.short_description: An ancient well said to have been frequented by early scholars, its water believed to impart clarity of thought and spiritual insight.
items.address: Close to the historic library, Rue 214, Tevragh-Zeina

items.name: The Weeping Spring of Fatima
items.short_description: A small, perennial spring, rare in the arid region, linked to the tears of a devout woman mourning her lost children, now a place for solace and remembrance.
items.address: Near the old cemetery, Sebkha, Nouakchott

items.name: Ma'in al-Janna (Spring of Paradise)
items.short_description: A legendary spring said to have emerged miraculously, its waters are believed to bring blessings and purity, especially when collected at dawn.
items.address: Fictional location: Outskirts of Ain-Tall (south of Nouakchott)

items.name: The Whispering Rocks of Azaz
items.short_description: An ancient geological formation outside the city, where wind-worn rocks create eerie whispers, believed to be the voices of ancient spirits or elemental energies.
items.address: Approx. 30 km east of Nouakchott, towards Akjoujt

items.name: Koudia al-Jinn (Hill of the Jinn)
items.short_description: A solitary hill rising from the flat desert, known in folklore as a dwelling place for jinn. Locals visit for protection or to leave offerings for good fortune.
items.address: North-east of Nouakchott, near PK 25

items.name: The Celestial Alignment Stone
items.short_description: A megalithic stone believed to align with specific celestial events, used by ancient peoples for astronomical observations and spiritual ceremonies.
items.address: Remote desert, accessible from Route de l'Espoir (N1)

items.name: The Oasis of Silent Reflection (Wahah al-Samt)
items.short_description: A small, secluded oasis known for its profound tranquility and isolation, offering a perfect setting for deep meditation and reconnection with nature's raw energy.
items.address: Fictional location: Deep in the Banc d'Arguin National Park buffer zone

items.name: The Sand Pyramid of Forgotten Kings (Tafra al-Muluk)
items.short_description: An ancient, sand-covered pyramidal burial mound (tumulus) from an unknown pre-Islamic civilization, believed to hold echoes of powerful rulers and their lost wisdom.
items.address: Remote desert, 50 km east of Nouakchott

items.name: Monument of Light and Reflection
items.short_description: A modern, architecturally symbolic pyramidal structure in a city park, designed for quiet contemplation and to reflect the spiritual connection between desert, sky, and human aspiration.
items.address: Parc National de Nouakchott (Green Zone), Tevragh-Zeina

items.name: The Geomantic Cairn of Direction
items.short_description: A historically significant, pyramidal cairn (stone stack) built by ancient nomads, used for orientation and believed to channel earthly energies for guidance.
items.address: South-west desert fringes of Nouakchott

items.name: The Oasis Pyramid of Al-Kantara
items.short_description: A fabled structure, rumored to be a small, stepped pyramid hidden near a desert oasis, guarded by local legends and said to reveal its secrets only to the truly pure of heart.
items.address: Fictional location: Deep desert oasis, far east of Nouakchott

items.name: Grotto of the Prophets' Footprints
items.short_description: A small, revered cave sanctuary with ancient markings, believed by local folklore to contain imprints left by early prophets or holy figures passing through the land.
items.address: Outskirts of Ksar, towards the desert

items.name: Ma'arat al-Salat (Cave of Prayer)
items.short_description: A naturally formed rock shelter, subtly enhanced for prayer, known for its quiet acoustics and serene atmosphere, ideal for deep spiritual reflection.
items.address: South-west desert fringe of Nouakchott

items.name: The Hidden Sanctuary of Al-Hima
items.short_description: A man-made sanctuary carved into a low rocky outcrop, used by small groups for secret spiritual gatherings and to preserve ancient communal rituals.
items.address: Fictional location: Near the coastal wetlands, west of Nouakchott

items.name: The Rock Art Gallery of Tagant
items.short_description: Though a bit further afield, this significant site is a series of rock shelters with ancient petroglyphs, accessible from Nouakchott, offering a glimpse into prehistoric spiritual beliefs and art.
items.address: Fictional location: Tagant region, accessible from Nouakchott by special trip

items.name: The Centre for Interfaith Dialogue
items.short_description: A contemporary architectural marvel designed to foster understanding and peace between different faiths, featuring spaces for meditation, lecture halls, and communal gardens.
items.address: Boulevard de la R.I.A., Tevragh-Zeina, Nouakchott

items.name: Al-Ahad Garden of Contemplation
items.short_description: A meticulously designed urban garden with geometric patterns and flowing water features, intended to promote mindfulness and inner peace amidst city life.
items.address: Adjacent to Olympic Stadium, Nouakchott

items.name: The Dome of Celestial Harmonies
items.short_description: A striking modern building with a large, intricately designed dome, serving as a hub for celestial observation, Islamic astronomy, and spiritual workshops.
items.address: Near the University of Nouakchott, Avenue de l'Université

items.name: The Well of Digital Dhikr
items.short_description: An innovative art installation and public space combining traditional Islamic remembrance (Dhikr) with digital light and sound, creating an immersive, meditative experience.
items.address: Public Plaza, Rue de l'Aéroport, Nouakchott

items.name: The Desert Rose Labyrinth
items.short_description: A sprawling, low-walled labyrinth built from local desert stones, designed for walking meditation and finding clarity amidst the natural elements.
items.address: Near the coast, north of Nouakchott city center

items.name: The Sufi Wisdom Walk (Hada'iq al-Aql)
items.short_description: A complex, mosaic-patterned labyrinth inlaid into the courtyard of a Sufi lodge, used for contemplative walking while reciting spiritual phrases or intentions.
items.address: Zawiya of Sheikh Hamdoun, Ksar, Nouakchott

items.name: The Children's Path of Patience
items.short_description: A smaller, colorful labyrinth in a public park designed to teach children focus and patience, drawing on traditional local patterns and stories.
items.address: Parc de la Jeunesse, Tevragh-Zeina, Nouakchott

items.name: Al-Mufakir Labyrinth (The Thinker's Labyrinth)
items.short_description: A conceptual art piece in a public space, this metallic labyrinth challenges visitors to navigate its turns while engaging with philosophical inscriptions and interactive soundscapes.
items.address: Place de l'Indépendance, Ksar, Nouakchott
